==Sindarin==
===Noun===
'''''tîn''''' (also appearing as '''''tin''''' and '''''tĭn''''') is a [[Sindarin]] word meaning "spark, sparkle (esp. used of the twinkle of [[stars]])" or "spark, star".<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, pp. 39, 66</ref>

====Etymology====

*[[Roots|Root]] TIN ("sparkle, spark")<ref name=PE17/>

====Examples====

*''[[Ithildin|Ithil'''din''']]''

====See also====
*[[Noldorin]] ''[[tinw]]''

===Adjective===

'''''tîn''''' (or ''tínen'') is a [[Sindarin]] word meaning "silent, quiet".<ref name=UI>{{HM|UI}}, p. 551</ref>

====Examples====

*''[[Rath Dínen|Rath '''Dínen''']]''<ref name=UI/>

==Neo-Sindarin==

The unattested form '''''tîn''''' is commonly held to mean "his (of nonsubject)" in [[Neo-Elvish|Neo-Sindarin]], related to ''[[dîn]]'' and ''[[în]]''.<ref>{{HM|GS}}, p. 325</ref><ref>[[Didier Willis]], [http://www.jrrvf.com/hisweloke/sindar/online/english.html Hiswelókë's Sindarin Dictionary] at [http://www.jrrvf.com/haut.shtml Jrrvf.com] (accessed 20 July 2011)</ref>
